alert.note: Alert for Bourbon (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 01 at 10:15AM CDT until June 03 at 8:52AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kansas and Missouri... Little Osage River at Fulton affecting Bourbon County. Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. .Heavy rainfall over the basin will cause rivers to rise above flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Osage River at Fulton. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Farmland at the gage site becomes covered by flood waters, and Highway 31, east of town becomes flooded. Highway 31, four miles west of Fulton has flood waters four to six feet in depth. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 19.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 25.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1015 AM CDT.
